A big thank you to our awesome community of students, parents and staff for making the materials pickup today and Sunday such a success! Maintaining social distancing was crucial and we appreciate how diligent everyone was in following the CDC’s recommendations. Nearly 5,000 students gathered their learning materials from LPS schools without one reported or observed violation of the social distancing requirements from CDC.

The Sandburg Elementary fourth grade class of Tammy Walter called "Game On" when Colorado Avalanche players Tyson Jost and JT Compher came to their school October 9 as part of the Future Goals Hockey Scholar Program. The Avs brought an inflatable street hockey rink and shooting target to the school playground (each student also received a street hockey stick and ball) so the students could get pointers from the pros. After lots of autographs and pictures, the players talked with the students about the Hockey Scholar Program and the importance of school work.
